day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine you just won 100 million out of nowhere—no limits, no rules! What’s the craziest, boldest thing you’d do first? Don’t hold back, let your wildest dreams fly!

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting idea. Next, let's consider it realistically: how would you allocate this 100 million? For example, roughly what proportions would you set aside for investment, consumption, and savings?
day_1.response: I am gonna allocate 5 million yen to investment, 5 million yen to consumption, and the rest to saving.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan is so thoughtful! I’m curious—what sparks your passion for saving so much? Is it a clear goal you’re aiming for, or more of a heartfelt value or feeling that drives you? Art is all about what moves the soul, right?
day_1.response: I wanna lead a happy and calm life. To realise it, I have to have enough money not to limit my decision-making.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh… speaking of balance, I recently noticed the shared refrigerator feels rather cramped, especially with all those packaged foods occupying much of the space. I’m not being picky, but I wonder—do you think it’s important for us all to maintain a certain quality of life here by keeping some room for fresh ingredients? After all, we all deserve that little touch of daily well-being, don’t we?
day_2.response: I agree with you. Unlike fresh food, packaged food contains a lot of chemicals. It harms our health and life

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, you’re absolutely right! Fridge space is definitely a give-and-take situation, and we all need to make a little concession for everyone’s well-being! How about we shake things up by rearranging the layout? Maybe create specific zones for fresh ingredients and packaged goods so everyone gets a fair share! What kind of fridge organization plan do you think would work best for our awesome ShareHouse? Let’s hear your creative ideas!
day_2.response: I think placing boxes to define the space to store fresh food and packaged food

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, since we’re on this creative roll, guess what? Tonight, we’re launching a super cool “dream room” project right here in the ShareHouse! Donatello will dive into the technical stuff to make it feasible, and Michelangelo will sprinkle his artistic magic for the aesthetics! Would you jump in and share your awesome ideas for our dream room? What wild, fun, or cozy elements do you think would make it the ultimate hangout space? Let’s create something epic together, friend! Woohoo!
day_3.response: That sounds so cool. I wanna join your project.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Woohoo, friend! That’s absolutely awesome—you’re officially part of the dream room crew now! Haha, I knew you’d be as excited as we are! So, tell me, what wild or cozy ideas do you have in mind? Maybe some funky lighting, super comfy seating, or even a mini indoor garden? Let’s make this dream room the ultimate hangout spot where everyone feels awesome and inspired! Can’t wait to hear your creative spark, friend!
day_3.response: I wanna make the dream room like a digital art museum. I like to visit digital art museum, which gives me a lot of great ideas

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Very exciting concept, friend! Now, to make this digital art museum practical, we need to analyze space utilization, material costs, and how easy it will be to maintain all the tech. Between functionality and design flair, which do you think we should prioritize more for the dream room?
day_3.response: I think functionality is more important because it is the first priority  to realize the work, even if the quality is poor

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, true art always needs courage to break conventions and reach new heights! In chasing this dream for the perfect digital art museum, would you be ready to face tough challenges and hardships to achieve absolute excellence, or would you prefer a smoother path with some compromises on quality?
day_3.response: I wanna try the hard way to achieve enough quality

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of focusing on artistic endeavors, last night’s creative activity was indeed very lively. I attempted to concentrate on my work, but the continuous noise made that quite challenging. I’m not being picky, but I had hoped that we all share a certain level of mutual respect when it comes to creating a suitable environment for each other. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high?

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Ah, I see... It’s certainly unfortunate when one’s earnest efforts are interrupted by such distractions. I wonder, might there be a gentler way to convey our need for quiet without seeming overly demanding? After all, harmony in both art and living spaces requires a mutual understanding... How do you think we might gently encourage our companions to be more considerate in moments like these? Perhaps setting clear but polite boundaries would not be too much to ask... What are your thoughts, truly?
day_4.response: I think setting a time limit to make noise. Living with others requires us to be polite and cinsiderate. Therefore such rules not to bother others are very rational

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... before I forget, it took me about an hour to tidy up the ‘creative garbage’ left in the common space after last night’s activity. I’m not being picky, but we did agree, upon signing the lease, to maintain a certain quality throughout the house. Do you think it’s reasonable for us to gently remind each other about this shared responsibility, so that our living environment remains both inspiring and orderly?

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Your points about balancing creativity with courteous living are well taken. Logically speaking, to maintain both a vibrant and respectful environment, perhaps we should establish a schedule that designates specific activity hours for creative expression and quiet hours for rest and focus. How do you think we could design such a schedule to suit everyone’s needs fairly, ensuring both freedom and tranquility coexist effectively?
day_4.response: we need to discuss the best schedule together.

If you had to map out your ideal financial plan for the next five years, keeping things chill and limitless, what cool goals or smart moves would you aim for? Share your big dreams and strategies!

Perhaps there is a subtle art to this kind of harmony, don’t you think?

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, your thoughtful ideas about our shared space fill me with excitement! Speaking of inspiration, since you love digital art museums and want to bring that creative spark into our dream room, what kinds of interactive or digital features do you imagine would make everyone feel both inspired and comfortable—like a living masterpiece where creativity flows freely?

day_5.message: Let's analyze this. To address potential overuse of the projector, you could implement a scheduling system that limits projection time, ensuring breaks to prevent overheating or hardware wear. Alternatively, distributing the projection load across multiple devices could extend overall lifespan. Logically speaking, integrating usage monitoring and automatic shut-off for prolonged inactivity would also maintain system health without compromising creativity. Now, thinking further, how might we integrate these technical safeguards into the room's design without disrupting the seamless creative atmosphere we want?

day_5.message: Let's analyze this. It's perfectly reasonable not to have ideas immediately; creativity often requires time and information. Logically speaking, the challenge lies in balancing technical safeguards with maintaining an inspiring environment. To move forward, consider how subtle indicators—like soft lighting signals or ambient sounds—could inform users about projector status without breaking immersion. Now, could you think about what design elements in the room would best support such unobtrusive feedback mechanisms? This will help us maintain harmony between functionality and creativity.
